div.sent: David was a famous man of his time.
He was the king of Israel.
God chose him to be the king of his race and anointed him through Samuel.
He was very intelligent.
He was a warrior too.
He won many battles.
But he could also compose psalms and play on the harp.
David was born in Bethlehem city.
His father was Jesse.
Among the six brothers and two sisters, David was the youngest.
From his early boyhood he could play on the harp very skillfully.
God was very pleased with David.
Saul was then king of Israel.
However, God chose David as the king of Israel after the death of the king.
But David was very tender in age.
He was merely a boy.
So according to God's will Prophet Samuel anointed David.
As a part of the rituals some oil was needed for anointation.
Horns of buffalo were used for carriying the oil for the rituals.
Samuel brought some oil in such a horn.
He poured the oil on David's head and anointed him.
Thus being anointed he began to prepare himself for becoming the king.
But he was yet to be a king.
He was very much fond of David's skills in it.
Naturally, the king liked David very much and brought him to his palace.
There David would play on the harp for the king.
The king enjoyed it very much.
Besides playing on the harp, David used to do some other works for the king.
David was an Israelite.
Once there was a fierce battle between the people of Israel and Palestine.
He said, Choose one of your best men to fight with me.
If he can defeat me, all the Palestinians will be your slaves.
But if I can kill him, all your people will be our slaves.
The soldiers of Israel were frightened at the challenge.
None of them dared to fight with him.
This wounded David's pride.
He bravely told the king Saul that he would fight with Goliath.
The king was amazed at David's courage.
David said in reply, I have protected my father's sheep from the lions.
God gave me the strength to do it.
God will protect me this time too.
King Saul felt proud at David's reply and permitted him to fight.
The king clothed David with his armour and put a bronze helmet on his head.
David fastened his sword to his armour and tried to walk.
But they were very heavy and too big for him.
As a result, he could not move with those armours.
David now put off the heavy armours.
Instead, he took a stick and a catapult in his hand.
He also took a few pieces of sharp stones.
With these David drew near to the Palestinian warrior.
At the sight of the little warrior -a mere boy, Goliath started jeering at him.
Little David threw one sharp edged stone at him with his catapult.
The stone cut deep into his forehead.
Goliath fell down on the ground.
David then jumped on Goliath and cut off his throat with Goliath's sword.
Palestinians saw their great warrior lying dead.
They were frightened at it and began to flee away.
On the other hand, the people of Israel started praising applauded David's victory.
David became the king of Israel when he was only 30 years old.
He loved his people very much.
He also loved God.
He composed many Psalms.
These were very important and beautiful.
We still sing these Psalms to praise our Lord.
